title: 112_hr1447
content: The Act titled "Aviation Security Stakeholder Participation Act of 2012" establishes the Aviation Security Advisory Committee. The Aviation Security Advisory Committee is established under the Act "Aviation Security Stakeholder Participation Act of 2012." It advises the Assistant Secretary on aviation security matters and develops recommendations for improvements in aviation security. The Aviation Security Advisory Committee develops recommendations for improvements in aviation security, which are approved by working groups and transmitted to the Assistant Secretary. The Committee also submits periodic reports on matters identified by the Assistant Secretary or by a majority of its members. The Advisory Committee periodically submits reports on matters identified by the Assistant Secretary or a majority of its members. An annual report is also submitted to the Assistant Secretary, detailing the activities, findings, and recommendations of the Committee. Membership is appointed by the Assistant Secretary within 180 days of the section's enactment. The Assistant Secretary appoints members of the Advisory Committee within 180 days of enactment. The Committee consists of representatives from various organizations in the air transportation industry, including air carriers, labor unions, aircraft manufacturers, and airport operators. The Advisory Committee consists of representatives from various organizations in the air transportation industry, including air carrier employees, aircraft manufacturers, airport operators, general aviation, privacy, the travel industry, and the aviation technology security industry. The Assistant Secretary may remove a member for cause at any time and members shall not receive compensation. Meetings are required at least semiannually, with additional meetings as necessary. The Assistant Secretary establishes an air cargo security working group within the Advisory Committee to provide recommendations on air cargo security issues. The working group meets quarterly and submits information and recommendations regarding air cargo security. The Assistant Secretary establishes a general aviation security working group within the Advisory Committee to provide recommendations on general aviation security issues. The working group includes members with expertise in general aviation operations and is cochaired by a Government and industry official. The Assistant Secretary establishes a general aviation security working group within the Advisory Committee, cochaired by a Government and industry official. The working group meets quarterly to provide recommendations on aviation security at general aviation airports for inclusion in the annual report. The Assistant Secretary establishes a perimeter security working group within the Advisory Committee to provide recommendations on airport perimeter security and access control issues. The working group meets quarterly to improve perimeter security and submit information for inclusion in the annual report. The working group within the Advisory Committee focuses on improving airport perimeter security and access control procedures. It meets quarterly to provide recommendations for inclusion in the annual report. The group includes experts in these areas and is cochaired by a Government and industry official. The Federal Advisory Committee Act does not apply to this group. The Aviation Security Advisory Committee, established to improve airport perimeter security, is not subject to the Federal Advisory Committee Act. Key definitions include the Advisory Committee, annual report, Assistant Secretary, and perimeter security measures. Perimeter security refers to systems and procedures that monitor and prevent unauthorized access to an airport, including its airfield and terminal. This includes the fence area, access gates, and access controls surrounding the airport. The House of Representatives passed the Aviation Security Advisory Committee bill on June 28, 2012.
